author: off_by_two
body: The xlnx merger might/should close this month too

author: AA92
body:
Yeah, definitely strange. I just took a look and of those leaving the list, 7 were for debt coverage. 

This score is a pass if (3\*Net Income) < (Long-term debt). I just quickly scanned AVY and it took on a lot of debt during its last report while CERN had a significant drop in net income as some examples. 

MPX does not have positive FCF over the TTM, so that one dropped out. 

XLNX left because its earnings yield is not greater than the treasury. 

So it's definitely a mix between the scores, but primarily debt related this month. 

\---

This is the third time I've run the list, so I don't have a way other than scanning the older lists and seeing the outcome. I'll see if I can come up with a solution for this though.

author: prettyboyv
body: Lisa Su said yesterday at a Credit Suisse conference, that she is confident that the merger with XLNX should be officially announced at the end if the year. The arbitrage between the 2 companies is nearly 20 percent as of today.
